economy.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way
economy.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
economy.translation[0].definitions[0].no: You say the economy when talking about the economic system in a particular country
Tourism is an important part of the economy
Tourism is an important part of economy
economy.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something that you do in order to spend less money
economy.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The council must make economies to meet government spending targets.
Not insuring your belongings is a false economy (=it is cheaper but could have bad results).
economy.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the careful use of money, time, goods etc so that nothing is wasted
economy.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
The company announced that it would cut 500 jobs as part of an economy drive (=a way to save money).
economy.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The new government inherited a strong economy.
The economy is weak and consumer confidence is low.
The country’s fragile economy depends almost exclusively on tourism.
The economy has been relatively stable for the last two or three years.
Measures aimed at reviving the stagnant economy are not working.
The government must take action to boost the flagging economy.
What can we learn from China’s booming economy?
Rising oil prices threaten the world economy.
The new factory has given a massive boost to the local economy.
The Japanese economy is showing signs of recovery.
the world’s two most powerful economies
Small economies like Kenya might struggle to survive in a global recession.
Many developing economies are investing in sources of renewable energy.
Expectations for growth in the main industrial economies remain low.
The early 1920s saw a rapid expansion in the American agricultural economy.
Britain has shifted from a manufacturing to a service economy.
Eastern European countries were gradually making the transition to a market economy.
the large capitalist economies of western Europe
Illegal immigrants have to seek work in the black economy.
Governments are judged on how well they manage the economy.
The tax cut should help to expand the economy.
It is hoped that the Olympic Games will boost the country’s economy.
The floods last year destroyed the region’s economy.
The economy grew by 3% last year.
The economy is booming and share prices are at an all-time high.
The US economy is slowing down after a long period of growth.
The economy is beginning to recover from the recession.
economy.translation[0].note_box[1].items: Don't confuse economy  (=a country's economic system) and economics  (=the study of how money is produced and used) You say
economy.translation[2].definitions[0].de: the system by which a country’s goods and services are produced and used, or a country considered in this way
economy.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: the transformation from a centrally planned socialist economy to a market-led one
He expects Europe’s economies over the long run to grow faster than the US’s.
economy.translation[2].definitions[1].de: the careful use of money, goods, time etc so that nothing is wasted
economy.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: For reasons of economy, the heating had been turned down.
The post office was closed as part of an economy drive (=a planned effort to cut costs).
economy.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a way of spending less money
economy.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: Following the merger, the group should make economies of about FFr200 million next year.
As an economy measure,  the company started to cut back on training.
economy.translation[2].definitions[3].de: something that seems to be a way of spending less money, but actually costs you more money in the end
economy.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: Buying cheaper, poorer quality materials is often a false economy.
economy.translation[3].definitions[0].de: an economy fare, hotel etc is cheaper than other things of the same type
economy.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: You can choose from a range of economy and medium-priced hotels.
economy.translation[3].definitions[1].de: an economy-size product or packet contains more than a normal one and is cheap compared to the normal size product
economy.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: a large economy-size packet of detergent
